title: Describing Your Daily Routine
description: Write about your typical day, including work or school activities.

prompt.description: Write about your typical weekday. Describe what you do from morning to evening, including work or school activities.
requirements: What time do you wake up?
How do you get to work/school?
What do you do during the day?
What do you do after work/school?
Use adverbs of frequency (always, usually, sometimes, etc.)

exampleSentences.sentence: I usually wake up at 7 o'clock every morning.
exampleSentences.useCase: To start describing your morning routine

exampleSentences.sentence: After breakfast, I commute to work by bus.
exampleSentences.useCase: To describe how you get to work

exampleSentences.sentence: I usually start work at 9 a.m.
exampleSentences.useCase: To talk about your work start time

exampleSentences.sentence: I often have meetings in the morning.
After work, I sometimes go to the gym.
I always try to go to bed before midnight.

vocabularyHelp.example: I take a break at noon.

usefulExpressions.example: First, I take a shower. Then, I have breakfast. After that, I leave for work.
In the morning, I check my emails.
I exercise three times a week.

items: Did you describe your morning routine?
Did you explain how you get to work/school?
Did you describe your main activities during the day?
Did you mention what you do after work/school?
Did you use adverbs of frequency?
Did you use present simple correctly?
Did you place adverbs of frequency in the correct position?
Did you use time expressions correctly?
Did you start sentences with capital letters?
Is your writing at least 80 words?
Is your writing no more than 120 words?
Are your sentences a good length?
Is your routine clear and easy to follow?
Is there good variety in your vocabulary?
Did you complete within the time limit?
